statsBulletinHeadline.headline1: In 2012 London had the highest GDHI per head, where the average person had £21,446 available to save or spend.
statsBulletinHeadline.headline2: Of the 37 NUTS2 sub-regions, in 2012 Inner London had the highest GDHI per head, where the average person had £24,940 available to save or spend.
statsBulletinHeadline.headline3: Between 2011 and 2012, GDHI per head of population increased in all NUTS1 regions.
statsBulletinHeadline.title: Regional Gross Disposable Household Income (GDHI), 2012
statsBulletinHeadline.summary: This bulletin presents the latest estimates of Gross Disposable Household Income (GDHI) for regions (see Table 1), sub-regions and local areas of the UK.

datasets.title: NUTS1 Regional Gross Disposable Household Income

statsBulletins.title: Regional Gross Disposable Household Income (GDHI), 2012
statsBulletins.summary: This bulletin presents the latest estimates of Gross Disposable Household Income (GDHI) for regions (see Table 1), sub-regions and local areas of the UK.

title: Regional accounts
summary: Regional Accounts are accounts for regions, sub-regions and local areas of the UK, produced according to the same concepts and definitions used in the National Accounts.  These accounts allow comparisons between regions and comparisons of a region against a UK average. Key statistics here are regional Gross Value Added (GVA) statistics and figures on regional Gross Disposable Household Income.

breadcrumb.title: Home
breadcrumb.summary: The UK's largest independent producer of official statistics and the recognised national statistical institute of the UK.

breadcrumb.title: Economy
breadcrumb.summary: An economy or economic system consists of the production, distribution, consumption and trade of limited goods and services by different agents in a given geographical location. The economic agents can be individuals, businesses, organisations, or governments.
